result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S O'Brien

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael S O'Brien appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting Attorney Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:27 AM Defendant Michael S O'Brien not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Stephen Sargent appears as a friend of the court. Mr O'Brien is to be eformed to determine his eligibility for SPD appointment of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael S O'Brien not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel in trial court and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael S O'Brien not in court, defendant in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in state for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Case is adjourned. Defense not present and did not make contact with the court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael S O'Brien in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael S O'Brien in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael S O'Brien appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
